byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Karam Shoumali and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.
byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and MAHER SAMAAN

abstract: Islamic State militants carry out attack in Syrian border town Kobani and begin effort to push government forces from city Dara'a; attacks appear aimed at countering losses elsewhere in country.
lead_paragraph: Islamic State militants set off car bombs in Kobani, where they had been driven out before by Kurdish guerrillas, and attacked the government-held city of Hasaka.

headline.main: ISIS Attacks Two Towns in Northern Syria
headline.print_headline: Hitting Back, ISIS Renews Its Offensive in North Syria

snippet: Islamic State militants set off car bombs in Kobani, where they had been driven out before by Kurdish guerrillas, and attacked the government-held city of Hasaka.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
